Package org.jtrim2.event.track

Class AbstractEventCauses

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.event.track.AbstractEventCauses
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventCauses
public abstract class AbstractEventCauses extends Object implements EventCauses
A convenient base class for EventCauses implementations.

This class provides default implementations for the methods getArgumentsOfKind}, isCausedByEvent} and isCausedByKind}.

Thread safety

The implemented methods keep the thread-safety property of subclasses, so if they adhere to the contract of EventCauses, the methods implemented by AbstractEventCauses will not break the contract.

Synchronization transparency

In case subclasses are synchronization transparent, the methods implemented by AbstractEventCauses are also synchronization transparent.

  • Method Details

    • getArgumentsOfKind

      public Iterable<Object> getArgumentsOfKind(Object eventKind)
      Returns the event arguments of the causing events having the specified event kind. The arguments are iterated in backwards order as they have occurred. That is, in the same order as iterated by the Iterable returned by the getCauses() method but different kind of events are filtered out.

      Implementation note: This method completely relies on the getCauses() method and filters out the events with different event kinds.

      Specified by:
      getArgumentsOfKind in interface EventCauses
      Parameters:
      eventKind - the kind of the causing events to be returned. This argument can be null, in which case an empty Iterable is returned because there can be no cause with null event kind.
      Returns:
      the event arguments of the causing events having the specified event kind. This method never returns null.

    • isCausedByEvent

      public boolean isCausedByEvent(TriggeredEvent<?> event)
      Checks if the specified event is amongst the causes.

      The equivalence is based on the equals method. That is, this method looks for events of the same kind and argument.

      Implementation note: This method completely relies on the getCauses() method. This method checks every element within the causes Iterable and returns true if finds the specified event amongst them.

      Specified by:
      isCausedByEvent in interface EventCauses
      Parameters:
      event - the event to be checked if it is amongst the causes. This argument can be null, in which case this method returns false.
      Returns:
      true if the event is amongst the causes, false otherwise

    • isCausedByKind

      public boolean isCausedByKind(Object eventKind)
      Checks if there is an event amongst the causes with the given event kind.

      The equivalence is based on the equals method.

      In case this method returns true, the getArgumentsOfKind returns a non-empty Iterable.

      Implementation note: This method completely relies on the getCauses() method. This method checks every element within the causes Iterable and returns true if finds an event amongst them with the given event kind.

      Specified by:
      isCausedByKind in interface EventCauses
      Parameters:
      eventKind - the kind of the event to be checked if there is such event amongst the causes. This argument can be null, in which case this method returns false.
      Returns:
      true if there is an event amongst the causes with the given event kind, false otherwise
